word:
Health Reformer, September, 1866
     345. Children are also fed too frequently, which produces feverishness and suffering in various ways. The stomach should not be kept constantly at work, but should have its periods of rest. Without it children will be peevish and irritable and frequently sick. 
     [CHILDREN TO BE TAUGHT WHEN AND HOW TO EAT--288] 
     [EARLY TRAINING OF DANIEL--241] 
     [SEE SECTION IX, REGULARITY IN EATING]
